  31. ‌uintnat caml_custom_major_ratio = Custom_major_ratio_def;
  32. ‌uintnat caml_custom_minor_ratio = Custom_minor_ratio_def;
  33. ‌uintnat caml_custom_minor_max_bsz = Custom_minor_max_bsz_def;

  35. ‌static value alloc_custom_gen (const struct custom_operations * ops,
  36.                                uintnat bsz,
  37.                                mlsize_t mem,
  38.                                mlsize_t max_major,
  39.                                mlsize_t mem_minor,
  40.                                mlsize_t max_minor)
  41. {
  42.   mlsize_t wosize;
  43.   CAMLparam0();
  44.   CAMLlocal1(result);

  46.   /* [mem] is the total amount of out-of-heap memory, [mem_minor] is how much
  47.      of it should be counted against [max_minor]. */
  48.   CAMLassert (mem_minor <= mem);

  50.   wosize = 1 + (bsz + sizeof(value) - 1) / sizeof(value);
  51.   if (wosize <= Max_young_wosize) {
  52.     result = caml_alloc_small(wosize, Custom_tag);
  53.     Custom_ops_val(result) = ops;
  54.     if (ops->finalize != NULL || mem != 0) {
  55.       if (mem > mem_minor) {
  56.         caml_adjust_gc_speed (mem - mem_minor, max_major);
  57.       }
  58.       /* The remaining [mem_minor] will be counted if the block survives a
  59.          minor GC */
  60.       add_to_custom_table (&Caml_state->minor_tables->custom, result,
  61.                            mem, max_major);
  62.       /* Keep track of extra resources held by custom block in
  63.          minor heap. */
  64.       if (mem_minor != 0) {
  65.         if (max_minor == 0) max_minor = 1;
  66.         Caml_state->extra_heap_resources_minor +=
  67.           (double) mem_minor / (double) max_minor;
  68.         if (Caml_state->extra_heap_resources_minor > 1.0) {
  69.           caml_request_minor_gc ();
  70.         }
  71.       }
  72.     }
  73.   } else {
  74.     result = caml_alloc_shr(wosize, Custom_tag);
  75.     Custom_ops_val(result) = ops;
  76.     caml_adjust_gc_speed(mem, max_major);
  77.     result = caml_check_urgent_gc(result);
  78.   }
  79.   CAMLreturn(result);
  80. }

  82. ‌CAMLexport value caml_alloc_custom(const struct custom_operations * ops,
  83.                                    uintnat bsz,
  84.                                    mlsize_t mem,
  85.                                    mlsize_t max)
  86. {
  87.   return alloc_custom_gen (ops, bsz, mem, max, mem, max);
  88. }

  90. ‌CAMLexport value caml_alloc_custom_mem(const struct custom_operations * ops,
  91.                                        uintnat bsz,
  92.                                        mlsize_t mem)
  93. {

  95.   mlsize_t mem_minor =
  96.     mem < caml_custom_minor_max_bsz ? mem : caml_custom_minor_max_bsz;
  97.   mlsize_t max_major =
  98.     /* The major ratio is a percentage relative to the major heap size.
  99.        A complete GC cycle will be done every time 2/3 of that much memory
  100.        is allocated for blocks in the major heap.  Assuming constant
  101.        allocation and deallocation rates, this means there are at most
  102.        [M/100 * major-heap-size] bytes of floating garbage at any time.
  103.        The reason for a factor of 2/3 (or 1.5) is, roughly speaking, because
  104.        the major GC takes 1.5 cycles (previous cycle + marking phase) before
  105.        it starts to deallocate dead blocks allocated during the previous cycle.
  106.        [heap_size / 150] is really [heap_size * (2/3) / 100] (but faster). */
  107.     caml_heap_size(Caml_state->shared_heap) / 150 * caml_custom_major_ratio;
  108.   mlsize_t max_minor =
  109.     Bsize_wsize (Caml_state->minor_heap_wsz) / 100 * caml_custom_minor_ratio;
  110.   value v = alloc_custom_gen (ops, bsz, mem, max_major, mem_minor, max_minor);
  111.   return v;
  112. }

  114. ‌struct custom_operations_list {
  115.   const struct custom_operations * ops;
  116.   struct custom_operations_list * next;
  117. };

  119. ‌typedef _Atomic(struct custom_operations_list *) custom_operations_table;

  121. /* Thread-safety: the tables are append-only lists, hence we only need
  122.    a CAS loop update them. */
  123. ‌static void push_custom_ops(custom_operations_table * table,
  124.                             const struct custom_operations * ops)
  125. {
  126.   struct custom_operations_list * l =
  127.     caml_stat_alloc(sizeof(struct custom_operations_list));
  128.   l->ops = ops;
  129.   struct custom_operations_list * prev = atomic_load(table);
  130.   do {
  131.     l->next = prev;
  132.   } while (!atomic_compare_exchange_weak(table, &prev, l));
  133. }

  135. ‌static custom_operations_table custom_ops_table = NULL;

  137. CAMLexport void
  138. ‌caml_register_custom_operations(const struct custom_operations * ops)
  139. {
  140.   CAMLassert(ops->identifier != NULL);
  141.   CAMLassert(ops->deserialize != NULL);
  142.   push_custom_ops(&custom_ops_table, ops);
  143. }

  145. ‌struct custom_operations * caml_find_custom_operations(char * ident)
  146. {
  147.   struct custom_operations_list * l;
  148.   for (l = atomic_load(&custom_ops_table); l != NULL; l = l->next)
  149.     if (strcmp(l->ops->identifier, ident) == 0)
  150.       return (struct custom_operations*)l->ops;
  151.   return NULL;
  152. }

  154. ‌static custom_operations_table custom_ops_final_table = NULL;

  156. ‌struct custom_operations * caml_final_custom_operations(final_fun fn)
  157. {
  158.   struct custom_operations_list * l;
  159.   struct custom_operations * ops;
  160.   for (l = atomic_load(&custom_ops_final_table); l != NULL; l = l->next)
  161.     if (l->ops->finalize == fn) return (struct custom_operations*)l->ops;
  162.   ops = caml_stat_alloc(sizeof(struct custom_operations));
  163.   ops->identifier = "_final";
  164.   ops->finalize = fn;
  165.   ops->compare = custom_compare_default;
  166.   ops->hash = custom_hash_default;
  167.   ops->serialize = custom_serialize_default;
  168.   ops->deserialize = custom_deserialize_default;
  169.   ops->compare_ext = custom_compare_ext_default;
  170.   ops->fixed_length = custom_fixed_length_default;
  171.   push_custom_ops(&custom_ops_final_table, ops);
  172.   return ops;
  173. }

  175. ‌void caml_init_custom_operations(void)
  176. {
  177.   caml_register_custom_operations(&caml_int32_ops);
  178.   caml_register_custom_operations(&caml_nativeint_ops);
  179.   caml_register_custom_operations(&caml_int64_ops);
  180.   caml_register_custom_operations(&caml_ba_ops);
  181. }
